SoC Verification



The projects were related to design verification for Exynos series in S.LSI division, Samsung Electronics.


Table of Contents

  • 1. Regression Automation
  • 2. Resource Management
  • 3. AMBA Bus Verification



1. Regression Automation


Description

The goal of this project was to automate SoC/IP regression workflow. It standardized and improved individual verification engineers' workflow and finally reduced TAT time before tape-out.

My role was to develop user interface and a server for SoC/IP regression automation. User interface includes Command Line Interface (CLI) and Graphical User Interface (GUI) with Perl/Python and Vue.js/Electron respectively. Django and Django REST Framework were used to develop a backend server. Gunicorn + Nginx were used to deploy a server as a service.

To see details, please refer to the paper in 'Related Articles' below.


Skills

Perl
Oracle PL/SQL

2. Resource Management


Description


The goal of this project was to schedule SoC/IP emulation resource efficiently and maximize emulation utilization.

My role was to develop resource scheduling algorithm to maximize resource utilization in different environment. I analyzed time series data and developed a dynamic resource scheduling algorithm based on data. The algorithm increased resource utilization by 20% and reduced total pending time by 70%.

Furthermore, to find out a better optimal solution, I researched Reinforcement Learning for resource management. First, I developed training environment and applied Double Deep Q Network (DDQN) algorithm. The research proved that DDQN algorithm had better performance than random algorithm or no algorithm in SoC/IP emulation resource management problem.

To see details, please refer to the paper in 'Related Articles' below, and the techinical details are described in machine learning/data analytics.


Skills

Oracle PL/SQL

3. AMBA Bus Verification


Description

The goal of this project was for AMBA Bus verification for Exynos design.

My role was to find out RTL bugs in APB and AHB. APB, an AMBA Peripheral Bus, is widely used to communicate between CPU and peripherals such as UART with low cost and low performance. AHB ,Advanced High Performance Bus, is mostly used for a high throughput and high performance such as data bus. I generated multiple testcases, including SFR test and burst tests with System Verilog and IWB.

I also automated bus verification workflow in Python.

Skills

System Verilog
Python
IWB
Verdi


Period

5 months

  • 1 June
    2020

  • 31 Nov
    2020
